snippet: The Chinese authorities said Mark Reilly, a Briton, had ordered his subordinates to form a “massive bribery network.”
abstract: Chinese authorities implicate Mark Reilly, former head of GlaxoSmithKline's China operations, in a long-running bribery scheme; move could potentially prompt drug companies to rethink their strategy in the fast-growing Chinese market.

byline.original: By DAVID BARBOZA and KATIE THOMAS
byline.contributor: David Barboza reported from Shanghai, and Katie Thomas from New York. Chad Bray contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The Chinese authorities said Mark Reilly, a Briton, had ordered his subordinates to form a “massive bribery network.”

headline.main: Former Head of Glaxo in China Is Accused of Bribery
headline.print_headline: Former Head of Glaxo in China Is Accused of Bribery
